dublin_core.dcvalue: Wright, C. G., Wendell, K. B., & Paugh, P. (2014). Reflective Decision Making within the Discourse of Urban Elementary Engineering Classrooms. In Joseph L. Polman, Eleni A. Kyza, D. Kevin O'Neill, Iris Tabak, William R. Penuel, A. Susan Jurow, Kevin O'Connor, Tiffany Lee, and Laura D'Amico (Eds.). Learning and Becoming in Practice: The International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2014. Volume 3. Colorado, CO: International Society of the Learning Sciences, pp. 1507-1508.

The emergence of engineering in K-12 education has promoted the need for research on discursive practices associated with successful pre-college engineering. Specifically, elementary students need support for engaging in collaborative, reflective decision-making during engineering design activities. In this poster, we describe an initial phase of work that looked to identify connections between elementary students' reflective decision-making linguistic practices and students' community/home-based linguistic practices.
Boulder, CO: International Society of the Learning Sciences
Reflective Decision Making within the Discourse of Urban Elementary Engineering Classrooms
